notesStmt.note: The seeming list of ailments on the lower left of the recto appears to be a continuation of the note that begins "May 30–31," and we have transcribed and encoded it as such.
No image of verso is currently available; according to the New York Public Library, the verso is blank.

Whitman's heading for these notes suggests this manuscript was composed on May 31, 1865. Union soldier James H. Williams was hospitalized in Armory Square in Washington, D.C. from May 26, 1865 to June 16, 1865.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Ashley Lawson Tim Jackson

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: A Series of Washington Hospital Notes. Written at the bedsides of wounded soldiers. Washington, 1863–1865.
bibl.orgName: The Oscar Lion Papers, 1914–1955, New York Public Library, New York, N.Y.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.head: ward C, bed F. May 31–'65
body.ab: James H. Williams - age 21 co G. 3d Va Cav.
May, 30–31—is about as marked a case of a strong man brought low as I have seen—has laryngytislaryngitis fever debility diarrhea
